name: Carrot Harissa Hummus
author: nch
summary: I've always found plain hummus rather bland. Adding harissa (preferably homemade, many brands add vinegar to it which I find unpalatable and it's not authentic), roasted carrots and sun-dried tomatoes however is a whole different story. Removing the skins from the chickpeas takes time but it is worth it, the hummus is much creamier even without adding lots of tahini.
ingredients: 1  carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch dice
1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for drizzling
directions: Soak chickpeas in plenty of cold water for 8 hours to overnight
Place in a saucepan and cover with fresh water
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and cook, covered, until soft, about 1 hour
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Mix carrots with 1 tablespoon olive oil and spread on a baking sheet
Bake until softened and lightly browned, about 25 minutes
Drain chickpeas and reserve cooking liquid
When chickpeas are cool enough to handle, slip off skins - this is easiest if you keep them immersed in warm water
Place drained peeled chickpeas into the bowl of a food processor
Add roasted carrots, garlic, tahini, harissa, sun-dried tomatoes, lemon juice, and lemon olive oil
Process until smooth, scraping down sides of bowl
Add more lemon juice and/or cooking water, 1 tablespoon at a time, if hummus is too stiff
Transfer hummus to a container with a tight-fitting lid and drizzle olive oil on top
